intro: Polygala vulgaris var. involutiflora, commonly known as the curled-flower milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spiral-like clusters along the stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry grasslands and open woodlands.
